communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Policies and Procedures:

Current policies, procedures, and guidelines related to roadside debris pickup, including standard operating procedures.

2. Service Schedules and Logs:

Schedules, logs, or records of roadside debris pickup services between March 1, 2024, and March 1, 2025, detailing dates, times, and locations.

3. Staffing Information:

Records detailing staffing levels for the Streets & Sanitation Department during the specified period, including personnel assigned to roadside debris pickup and any documented staffing shortages.

4. Complaint Records:

Records of complaints or service requests received regarding roadside debris pickup from residents between March 1, 2024, and March 1, 2025, including the nature of each complaint, date received, and resolution status.

5. Internal Communications:

Internal communications, such as emails, memos, or reports, discussing delays, challenges, or issues related to roadside debris pickup services within the specified timeframe.

6. Budget and Funding Documents:

Documents outlining budget allocations and expenditures for the Streets & Sanitation Department for the fiscal years covering July 1, 2023, to June 30, 2024, and July 1, 2024, to June 30, 2025, with emphasis on funds allocated for roadside debris management.

7. Contractor Agreements:

Contracts, agreements, or memorandums of understanding with third-party vendors or contractors hired to perform roadside debris pickup services during the specified period.

8. Performance Reports:

Performance evaluations, audit reports, or assessments conducted internally or by external entities regarding the efficiency and effectiveness of the roadside debris pickup services between March 1, 2024, and March 1, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Rep. Mary Cavanagh Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: February 25, 2023
Location: Livonia, Michigan
Individual Involved: Mary Cavanagh, 30
Incident Summary: Rep. Mary Cavanagh was pulled over around 2 a.m. after officers observed her swerving between lanes and driving with two flat tires. During the traffic stop, she admitted to drinking at a political fundraiser and underwent a field sobriety test, which she failed. Officers conducted a breathalyzer test, recording a BAC of .176% on scene and later .2% at the police station. She was subsequently arrested for driving under the influence.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Conducted the traffic stop and initial interaction with Rep. Cavanagh.
Administered the field sobriety test and breathalyzer.
Transported her to the Livonia Police Department for further testing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: March 25, 2021
Location: Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, Atlanta, GA
Individual Involved: Scott Russell Granden, 36
Incident Summary: Granden was arrested upon landing after allegedly sexually assaulting a female passenger aboard a Southwest Airlines flight. The victim reported that Granden groped her while she was asleep and later smacked her buttocks when she stood up. Upon arrival at the airport, Atlanta Police officers detained Granden, who was reportedly intoxicated and made racist and homophobic slurs toward officers. He also pulled down his pants and shouted inappropriate remarks.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the aircraft upon landing and interacted with Scott Russell Granden.
Documented Granden’s statements and behavior during his detention and arrest.
Transported Granden following the arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Georgia Open Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Scott Russell Granden Arrest
communications.communication:
Good morning, Harun,

For reference, the case number associated with your request is 210848060.

We were able to locate approximately 3.25 hours of footage associated with your request. We estimate that preparing this footage for release will take approximately 9.75 hours and one month.

Our cost for processing is $23.31 an hour, with the first 15 minutes free. We estimate that this request will cost $221.45.

Please let us know if you agree with this fee and wish for us to move forward with your request.

Please keep in mind that the information released is preliminary in nature and could change as the investigation progresses or new information comes to light.

The latest information on significant incidents will be posted to the Atlanta Police Department’s News List<https://www.atlantapd.org/about-apd/advanced-components/news-list>.

Please submit open records request using the following form: APD Media Open Records Request<https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=ClUaA_PxYkucZD7wLHeYpSfF4TjkfrBPtRhKKcURihpUMEFQTzhPTFVORDc2VE1LM1lUV09aOVJUVCQlQCN0PWcu&wdLOR=cCF6D88AD-E9FF-49E3-B699-B4FEEA403391>

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Charles Snowden DUI Arrest

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Charles Snowden DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: December 9, 2024
Location: Rainbow Boulevard near Sunset Road, Las Vegas, Nevada
Individual Involved: Charles Snowden (Las Vegas Raiders player)
Incident Summary: Officers responded to a report of a suspicious vehicle at approximately 11:30 p.m. and found Charles Snowden passed out behind the wheel of a running 2017 Jeep Grand Cherokee. The vehicle was in neutral and nearly rolled off a four-foot retaining wall. Upon interacting with officers, Snowden appeared disoriented, initially stating that he believed he was in Florida. A breathalyzer test later showed a blood alcohol level more than double the legal limit.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Initially arrived at the scene and located Charles Snowden in his vehicle.
Interacted with Snowden and conducted any field sobriety or breathalyzer tests.
Participated in the arrest and transport of Snowden.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sandra Doorley Traffic Stop
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 04/22/2024
Location: Webster, New York (Phillips Road and Doorley’s residence)
Individual Involved: Sandra Doorley (Monroe County District Attorney)
Incident Summary: On the date of the incident, DA Sandra Doorley was reportedly stopped for speeding—driving 55 mph in a 35 mph zone. Instead of pulling over, she called Webster Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier and proceeded home, refusing to comply with the officer’s order to stop. Bodycam footage shows a tense exchange in which she stated she "didn’t feel like stopping" and refused to exit her garage. The officer informed her that failure to stop is an arrestable offense.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Attempted to pull over Sandra Doorley for the traffic violation.
Responded to her residence and engaged in conversation with her.
Communicated with Police Chief Dennis Kohlmeier regarding the situation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – DaniLeigh DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: May 30, 2023
Location: Miami Beach, Florida
Individual Involved: Danielle Leigh Curiel (DaniLeigh)
Incident Summary: Miami Beach police arrested DaniLeigh around 8:15 AM following a DUI hit-and-run crash that left a moped driver with serious injuries, including a kidney laceration and spinal fracture. Officers reported that DaniLeigh was speeding and swerving before striking the victim. She was later stopped and administered a breathalyzer, which showed a BAC of 0.148—nearly twice the legal limit. The arrest resulted in three felony charges, including DUI with serious bodily injury and leaving the scene of an accident.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the crash scene and interacted with the injured victim.
Conducted the traffic stop on DaniLeigh’s vehicle.
Administered the field sobriety and breathalyzer tests.
Processed her arrest and transport to Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Christina Laboy

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Arrest of Christina Laboy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: Palm Beach County, FL
Suspect: Christina Laboy, 46
Incident Summary: Christina Laboy was pulled over for driving over 100 mph and swerving on the road. After initially being given a warning, she engaged in a racially charged outburst toward officers, referring to one officer as "George Floyd" and making multiple offensive remarks. She also accused an officer of sexual harassment and kicked at officers while resisting arrest. Laboy was ultimately arrested and charged with battery, resisting arrest, and corruption by threat.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Conducted the traffic stop and initial field sobriety test.
Interacted with Christina Laboy during her verbal outbursts.
Placed her under arrest and transported her to the police station.
Booked her into custody and documented her continued behavior.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Crime Incident Data Request (Portland Police Bureau)

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Crime Incident Data Request (Portland Police Bureau)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009, 2011, and 2013
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block
